page.title: 13LIFE IN NORTHWEST PENRITH
page.content: Life in north west Penrith somtimes gets very rough.There is a man that goes round threatening and chasing children.Many of the men that live on Voreda Park Estate work for British Gypsum.The railway line runs straight past Raislands Croft,& lads throw stones at passing trains,which I think is stupid:you never know what might happen.When I am not out delivering papers I like to walk my dogs and to play Football.On the Voreda Park Estate all we have is one tiny little patch of grass about 40 sq.meters! When I leave school I hope someday to start my own business,this week-end I am going to wash cars with one of my friends.We are not bothered about the Fells & the Lakes,because we are so used to it around us,& in the Summer it's packed with Tourists.
